intro: Hibbertia monogyna, commonly known as the single-flowered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red stamens. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and has small, elliptical leaves. Hibbertia monogyna thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in native gardens.
